thread.title: Newnan unable to continue successful first year under new coach in Sweet 16
thread.title_full: Newnan unable to continue successful first year under new coach in Sweet 16

title: Newnan unable to continue successful first year under new coach in Sweet 16
text:
Newnan unable to continue successful first year under new coach in Sweet 16 Wednesday, October 21, 2015 Comments 
NORCROSS—Newnan’s volleyball team accomplished several things under first-year head coach Krista Wilson. 
It will have to wait at least one more season before it gets to the Class Elite 8. 
The Lady Cougars’ hopes of extending its 2014 season ended on the road Tuesday after getting swept by Norcross (25-21, 25-15, and 25-20) in the Class Sweet 16. 
With the loss, the Lady Cougars finish the season with a 29-17 record in Krista Wilson’s first year as head coach. Newnan won this year’s 
Coweta County Championship and advanced to the Sweet 16 in Class with a first-round win over Rockdale County last week. In Tuesday’s season-ending contest, both teams were challenged by hitting the ball over a front line that including a 6-foot athletes. 
Six-foot, two-inch Jenni Young and 6-0 Anna Marie Campbell helped control the front line for the Lady Cougars, but Norcross countered with their own tall-lineup, including 6-foot-2 Tia Jimerson and 6-2 Sam Lanning. 
Norcross size eventually wore down Newnan, who cut into the lead a few time, but could never totally seize the momentum. 
“We get down on ourselves pretty quickly,” Wilson said. “That’s something we need to work on for next season—not getting down we we have only a (three point) deficit.” More
